intro: Sida cabreriana, commonly known as redroot sida, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, often in disturbed soils. Its leaves are ovate with a hairy surface, and it produces small, pale pink to white flowers. Sida cabreriana is notable for its deep root system, which allows it to thrive in dry conditions.
